meanings.definition: A hybrid offspring of a male donkey and a female horse.
meanings.sent1: The mule carried heavy loads up the mountain.
meanings.sent2: The farmer used a mule to plow the field.
meanings.sent3: The mule refused to move, causing a comical scene.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was as strong as a mule.
meanings.sent5: The mule's ears twitched as it listened to the birds chirping.

meanings.sent1: Don't be a mule and listen to others' advice.
meanings.sent2: She can be a real mule when she doesn't get her way.
meanings.sent3: His mule-like behavior made everyone chuckle.
meanings.sent4: She dug in her heels like a mule, refusing to budge.
meanings.sent5: The mule of the group, he always had to have the last word.

meanings.definition: A slipper or shoe without a back.
meanings.sent1: She slipped on her mules before heading out.
meanings.sent2: The comfortable mules were perfect for lounging at home.
meanings.sent3: He accidentally wore his mules to the fancy dinner.
meanings.sent4: The mules made a soft sound as she walked on the carpet.
meanings.sent5: Her favorite mules were worn out from daily wear.
